tuv.seg: The primary legislation under which criminal charges for drugs offences is brought is the Misuse of Drugs Act 1977 and the Misuse of Drugs Act, 1984
Is iad an tAcht um Mí-Úsáid Drugaí 1977 agus an tAcht um Mí-Úsáid Drugaí 1984 an phríomhreachtaíocht faoina ndéantar cúisimh choiriúla mar gheall ar chionta drugaí a thionscnamh
These have been further amended by the Criminal Justice Act 1999, the Criminal Justice Act 2006 and the Criminal Justice Act 2007
Leasaíodh na hAchtanna sin tuilleadh leis an Acht um Cheartas Coiriúil 1999, leis an Acht um Cheartas Coiriúil 2006 agus leis an Acht um Cheartas Coiriúil 2007
The Misuse of Drugs Regulations 1988 (SI 328 of 1988) (as amended) lists the various substances to which the legislation applies
Tá liosta sna Rialacháin um Mí-Úsáid Drugaí 1988 (I.R. 328 de 1988) de na substaintí éagsúla lena mbaineann an reachtaíocht
The Criminal Justice (Psychoactive Substances) Act 2010 covers substances which are not specifically proscribed under the Misuse of Drugs Acts, but which have psychoactive effects
Cuimsítear faoin Acht um Cheartas Coiriúil (Substaintí Sícighníomhacha), 2010 substaintí nach sainordaítear faoi na hAchtanna um Mí-Úsáid Drugaí, ach ag a bhfuil tionchar sícighníomhach
The main drug offences under which criminal charges are brought are offences of drug possession and possession for the purpose of supply
Is iad na príomhchionta drugaí faoina ndéantar cúisimh choiriúla a thionscnamh cionta a bhaineann le seilbh drugaí agus seilbh chun críche soláthair
Role of the Garda Siochana in combating drug abuse and drug trafficking
Ról an Gharda Síochana chun troid i gcoinne mhí-úsáid agus gháinneáil drugaí
The work of the Criminal Assets Bureau , established in 1996, has been very successful in seizing the assets of those convicted of drug trafficking
D’éirigh thar cionn le Biúró na Sócmhainní Coiriúla, a bunaíodh i 1996, seilbh a ghabháil ar shócmhainní na ndaoine siúd a ciontaíodh as gáinneáil drugaí
The Garda Siochana has also established the National Drugs Unit to target national and international drugs trafficking
Lena chois sin bhunaigh an Garda Síochána an tAonad Náisiúnta Drugaí le díriú ar gháinneáil náisiúnta agus idirnáisiúnta na ndrugaí
At local level, Local Drugs Units police the drugs situation and Garda juvenile liaison officers work with young people to try and prevent them getting involved with drugs
Déanann na hAonaid Áitiúla Drugaí póilíneacht ar chúrsaí drugaí agus oibríonn oifigigh idirchaidreamh d’ógánaigh de chuid an Gharda le daoine óga chun iarracht a dhéanamh a mbaint le drugaí a chosc
In some Local Drugs Task Force areas, Community Policing Fora have been set up to deal with the drug problem with the help of the community
Tá Fóraim um Póilíneacht Pobail bunaithe i roinnt ceantar de chuid Thascfhórsaí Áitiúla Drugaí le cabhair an phobail a fháil le dul i ngleic le fadhb na ndrugaí

In October 2008 Dial to Stop Drug Dealing was launched. This initiative tackled drug dealing in local communities by providing a confidential and completely anonymous way for someone to pass on information on drug dealing in their local community to the Gardaí

Is tionscnamh Dial to Stop Drug Dealing chun ngleic mangaireacht drugaí i bpobail áitiúla trí bhealach rúnda agus go hiomlán gan ainm do dhuine a chur ar aghaidh maidir le faisnéis ar mangaireacht drugaí ina bpobal áitiúil do na Gardaí
The Gardai are also involved in a number of awareness-raising programmes such as the Garda Schools Programme and the Juvenile Diversion Programme
Bíonn baint ag na Gardaí le roinnt clár spreagtha feasachta freisin ar nós Chlár Scoileanna na nGardaí agus an Clár Athstiúrtha na hÓige
Role of the Customs and Excise service in combating drug trafficking
Ról na Seirbhíse Custam agus Máil sa troid i gcoinne na gáinneála drugaí
The Customs and Excise services are responsible for detecting and seizing controlled drugs at importation

Tá freagracht ag na Seirbhísí Custam agus Máil as drugaí srianta a aimsiú agus a ghabháil ag a n-allmhairiú Oibríonn na Gardaí agus na Seirbhísí Custam agus Máil as lámha a chéile chun forghníomhú na ndlíthe drugaí

There is close co-operation between the Gardai and the Custom and Excise services in the area of drug law enforcement and a joint task force involving the Gardai, the Customs and Excise Services and the Naval Services has been set up
Bunaíodh comh-thascfhórsa idir na Gardaí, na Seirbhísí Custam agus Máil agus an tSeirbhís Chabhlaigh, agus bíonn siad in idirchaidreamh le chéile go háitiúil le cosc a chur ar gháinneáil drugaí

These bodies liaise at a local level to prevent drug trafficking. The Customs and Excise services are involved in the Multi-Disciplinary Group on Organised Crime and are also very involved in the operation of the Criminal Assets Bureau with the Gardai

Tá na Seirbhísí Custam agus Máil bainteach freisin leis an nGrúpa Il-disciplíneach um Choiriúlacht Eagraithe agus lena chois sin tugann siad féin agus na Gardaí gach cabhair d’oibriú Bhiúró na Sócmhainní Coiriúla
The Customs National Drug Team was set up by the Revenue Commissioners in 1992 to tackle the illegal importation of drugs into Ireland
Bhunaigh na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim Foireann Náisiúnta Drugaí na gCustam i 1992 le dul i ngleic le hallmhairiú mídhleathach drugaí isteach go hÉirinn
Customs National Drug Team
Foireann Náisiúnta Drugaí na gCustam
The Customs National Drug Team (CNDT) concentrates solely on combating the importation of illegal drugs into Ireland
Díríonn Foireann Náisiúnta Drugaí na gCustam (FNDC) a haire go hiomlán ar an troid i gcoinne allmhairiú drugaí mídhleathacha isteach sa tír

The CNDT has its Head Office located in Dublin and intelligence units, operational units, maritime units and drug detector dog units that are strategically placed at all major ports and airports and at various coastal locations nation-wide

Tá FNDC Ceannáras i mBaile Átha Cliath agus in aonaid fhaisnéise, feidhmiúcháin agus muirí agus aonaid na madraí braite drugaí atá lonnaithe go straitéiseach ag gach calafort agus aerfort mór agus ag ionaid éagsúla ar fud chósta na tíre
All CNDT units are mobile and can be deployed to other locations as necessary
Tá gach aonad FNDC soghluaiste; féadfar iad a imlonnú chuig ionaid eile de réir mar is gá
The CNDT is supported by outfield officials who are also responsible for the detection and prevention of drug smuggling as part of their normal duties
Tá oifigeach allamuigh eile ann chun tacú leis an FNDC leis an bhfreagracht acu as brath agus cosc smuigleáil drugaí mar chuid dá ngnáthdhualgais
Possession of controlled drugs - cannabis or cannabis resin
Seilbh ar dhrugaí srianta - cannabas nó roisín cannabais
Under the Misuse of Drugs Acts anyone found in possession of cannabis or cannabis resin is guilty of an offence
De réir na hAchtanna um Mí-Úsáid Drugaí, bíonn aon duine a fhaightear le cannabas nó roisín cannabais ina seilbh acu ciontach i gcion
If the court decides that the drug was for personal use and not for sale or distribution and this was a first offence, it can impose a class D fine on summary conviction in a District Court

Má chinneann an chúirt gur le húsáid phearsanta agus nár lena ndíol nó lena ndáileadh a bhí an druga, agus gurbh é seo an chéad chion ag an duine sin, féadfaidh sí rang D fíneáil a ghearradh ar chiontú achomair sa Cúirt Dúiche
On conviction on indictment, the defendant can be fined €1,270
Ar chiontú ar díotáil is féidir fíneáil €1,270 a ghearradh orthu
For a second offence, a class D fine may be imposed and on conviction on indictment, a fine of €2,540 can be imposed
Don dara cion is féidir rang D fíneáil a ghearradh agus €2,540 d’fhíneáil ar chiontú ar díotáil
For a third or subsequent conviction, a class C fine can be imposed
Don tríú nó do gach ciontú ina dhiaidh sin is féidir rang C fíneáil a ghearradh
If the court decides, a prison sentence of not more than 12 months can be imposed as well
Más é cinneadh na cúirte é féadtar téarma príosúnachta 12 mí a ghearradh freisin
On conviction on indictment, the court may decide on an appropriate fine and/or a prison sentence of up to three years can be imposed
Ar chiontú ar díotáil, féadann an chúirt fíneáil iomchuí a shocrú agus/nó is féidir pianbhreith suas le trí bliana a ghearradh
Possession of any other controlled drugs
Seilbh ar aon drugaí srianta eile
It is an offence to be in possession of a controlled drug and on summary conviction for this offence, you could be liable for a class C fine or a prison sentence of no longer than 12 months
Is cion é druga srianta a bheith i seilbh duine agus ar chiontú achomhair don chion seo, d’fhéadfá a bheith faoi dhliteanas as rang C fíneáil nó pianbhreith príosúnachta nach faide ná 12 mí é
If the court decides, you could be liable for both
Féadann an chúirt a chinneadh go gcaithfeá an dá phionós a íoc
On conviction on indictment for possessing controlled drugs, the court can decide on an appropriate fine and you could also be liable for a prison sentence of not more than 7 years
Ar chiontú ar díotáil i seilbh drugaí srianta, is féidir leis an chúirt fíneáil iomchuí a shocrú agus d’fheadfá a bheith faoi dhliteanas as tréimhse príosúnachta nach mó ná 7 mbliana
Again, if the court decides, you could be liable for both
Agus arís, d’fhéadfadh an chúirt an dá phionós a ghearradh ort
Growing cannabis plants or opium poppies
Plandaí cannabais nó codlaidín a fhás

It is also an offence to grow cannabis plants or opium poppies and on summary conviction for this offence, you could be liable for a class C fine or a prison sentence of no longer than 12 months. If the court decides, you could be liable for both

Is cion freisin é plandaí cannabais nó codlaidín a fhás agus d’fhéadfaí rang C fíneáil nó tréimhse príosúnachta nach mó ná 12 mí a ghearradh ort ar do chiontú achomair, agus d’fhéadfadh an chúirt a chinneadh an dá phionós a ghearradh ort
On conviction on indictment for growing these plants, the court can decide on an appropriate fine and you could also be liable for a prison sentence of not more than 14 years
Ar do chiontú ar díotáil as na plandaí sin a fhás, féadann an chúirt fíneáil iomchuí a shocrú agus d’fhéadfá a bheith faoi dhliteanas príosúnacht nach mó ná 14 bliain
Again, if the court decides, you could be liable for both
Lena chois sin d’fhéadfadh an chúirt a chinneadh an dá phionós a ghearradh ort

It is an offence to use prepared opium (e.g., heroin) for illegal use, to go to a place for the purposes of using opium or to have any paraphernalia (pipes, utensils) associated with illegal opium use in your possession

Is cion é úsáid mhídhleathach a bhaint as codlaidín ullmhaithe (m.sh. hearóin), dul go hionad chun críoch codlaidín a úsáid nó ceann ar bith de na giuirléidí sin (píopaí, uirlisí) a bhaineann le mí-úsáid codlaidín a bheith i do sheilbh agat
On summary conviction for this offence, you could be liable for a class C fine or a prison sentence of no longer than 12 months
Is féidir rang C fíneáil a ghearradh ort ar chiontú go hachomair tú don chion seo, nó d’fhéadfaí tú a chur go príosún ar feadh tréimhse nach mó ná 12 mí
If the court decides, you could be liable for both
D’fhéadfadh an chúirt a chinneadh an dá phionós a ghearradh ort
On conviction on indictment for this offence, the court can decide on an appropriate fine and you could also be liable for a prison sentence of no more than 14 years
Ar chiontú ar díotáil don chion seo, d’fhéadfadh an chúirt méid na fíneála a shocrú agus d’fhéadfá a bheith faoi dhliteanas do thréimhse nach mó ná 14 bliain phríosúnachta
Again, if the court decides, you could be liable for both
Lena chois sin d’fhéadfadh an chúirt an dá phionós a ghearradh ort
Possession of controlled drugs for sale or supply
Seilbh drugaí rialaithe lena ndíol nó lena soláthar
Under the legislation, it is an offence to be in possession of a controlled drug with the intention of selling it illegally
Faoin reachtaíocht, is cion é a bheith i seilbh druga rialaithe agus é ar intinn é a dhíol go mídhleathach
Anyone found guilty of this offence is liable to a class C fine on summary conviction in a District Court
Is féidir rang C fíneáil a ghearradh ar aon duine a gheofar ciontach sa chion sin ar é nó í a chiontú go hachomair i gCúirt Dúiche
If the court decides, he or she could be subject to a fine and a prison term not exceeding 12 months
Má chinneann an chúirt amhlaidh, d’fhéadfaí fíneáil agus téarma príosúnachta nach faide ná 12 mhí a chur air nó uirthi
On conviction on indictment for this offence, the court can decide on an appropriate fine
Ar dhuine a chiontú ar díotáil sa chion sin, is féidir leis an gcúirt cinneadh a dhéanamh i dtaobh fíneála cuí
The court can also impose a life sentence for this offence if it decides it is necessary
Is féidir leis an gcúirt freisin pianbhreith saoil a fhorchur mar gheall ar an gcion sin má chinneann sí gur gá é
However, lesser sentences can also be imposed, either with a fine or alone
Is féidir pianbhreitheanna níos giorra ná sin a fhorchur freisin áfach, i dteannta fíneála nó leo féin
Where the market value of the drugs is €13,000 or more, the person convicted is liable for a minimum sentence of 10 years
I gcás gur €13,000 nó níos mó margadhluach na ndrugaí, dlítear pianbhreith íosta 10 mbliana a chur ar an duine a chiontaítear
This does not apply, however, where the court is satisfied there are exceptional circumstances
Níl feidhm ag an méid sin áfach i gcás inar deimhin leis an gcúirt go bhfuil imthosca eisceachtúla i gceist
Similar penalties apply to somone convicted of importing drugs with a value of €13,000 or more
Tá pionóis den tsamhail chéanna infheidhme maidir le duine a chiontaítear in allmhairiú drugaí a bhfuil luach €13,000 nó níos mó leo

Anyone found guilty of supplying or attempting to supply a controlled drug into a prison, children detention school or remand centre can receive a class B fine on summary conviction or a prison term not exceeding 12 months or both

Is féidir rang B fíneáil nó téarma príosúnachta nach faide ná 12 mhí, nó iad araon, a chur ar aon duine a gheofar ciontach i ndruga rialaithe a sholáthar nó in iarracht a dhéanamh druga rialaithe a sholáthar i bpríosún nó i scoil choinneála leanaí nó in ionad coinneála ar é nó í a chiontú go hachomair
On conviction on indictment, the court can impose an appropriate fine or a maximum prison term of 10 years or both
Ar dhuine a chiontú ar díotáil, is féidir leis an gcúirt fíneáil chuí nó téarma príosúnachta uasta 10 mbliana, nó iad araon, a chur air nó uirthi

Under the Criminal Justice (Psychoactive Substances) Act 2010 it is an offence to sell or supply for human consumption substances which are not specifically proscribed under the Misuse of Drugs Acts, but which have psychoactive effects

Faoin Acht um Cheartas Coiriúil (Substaintí Sícighníomhacha), 2010, cion é substaintí a dhíol nó a sholáthar do thomhaltas ag daoine nach sainordaítear faoi na hAchtanna um Mí-Úsáid Drugaí, ach ag a bhfuil tionchar sícighníomhach
Anyone found guilty of such an offence is liable for a class A fine on summary conviction or imprisoned for a term not exceeding 12 months or both
Beidh aon duine a chiontaítear i leith na ciona sin faoi dhliteanas fíneáil aicme A a íoc ar ciontú acomhair nó tréimhse a chaitheamh sa phríosún le haghaidh téarma nach faide ná 12 mhí nó an dá rud
On conviction on indictment they can be fined or imprisoned for a term not exceeding 5 years or both
Ar ciontú ar comhdhíotáil, is féidir fíneáil a ghearradh ar an duine sin nó iad a chur sa phríosún le haghaidh téarma nach faide ná 5 bliana nó an dá rud
Use of premises, vehicles or vessels for certain activities
Áitreabh, feithiclí nó soithí a úsáid le haghaidh gníomhaíochtaí áirithe

Anyone who occupies or controls any land, vehicle or vessel and is found guilty of allowing it to be used for activities such as the manufacture, importation or supply of a controlled drug is liable on summary conviction to a class C fine or a prison sentence of no longer than 12 months or both

Aon duine a bhfuil aon talamh, feithicil nó soitheach ar áitiú nó faoina rialú aige nó aici agus a gheofar ciontach i gceadú an talamh, an fheithicil nó an soitheach sin a úsáid le haghaidh gníomhaíochtaí ar nós druga rialaithe a mhonarú, a allmhairiú nó a sholáthar, dlífear, ar é nó í a chiontú go hachomair, rang C fíneáil nó pianbhreith phríosúnachta nach faide ná 12 mhí, nó iad araon, a chur air nó uirthi
On conviction on indictment for this offence, the court can impose an appropriate fine or a prison sentence of no more than 14 years or both
Ar dhuine a chiontú ar díotáil sa chion sin, is féidir leis an gcúirt fíneáil chuí nó pianbhreith phríosúnachta nach faide ná 14 bliana, nó iad araon, a chur air nó uirthi
Forged or fraudulently altered prescriptions
Oidis a bhrionnaítear nó oidis a athraítear go calaoiseach
It is an offence to forge a prescription or to try to change it in any way in order to deceive
Is cion é oideas a bhrionnú nó athrú ar bith a dhéanamh air chun dallamullóg a chur ar dhuine
Anyone found guilty of this offence is liable, on summary conviction, to a class D fine or a prison sentence not exceeding 6 months
Is féidir rang D fíneáil nó tréimhse phríosúnachta nach mó ná 6 mhí a ghearradh ar dhuine ar chiontú go hachomair iad
If the court decides, you could be liable for both
D’fhéadfadh an chúirt an dá phionós a ghearradh orthu
On conviction on indictment for this offence, the court can decide on an appropriate fine and/or impose a prison term not exceeding 3 years
Ar chiontú ar díotáil don chion seo d’fhéadfadh an chúirt méid chuí a shocrú don fhíneáil agus/nó tréimhse phríosúnachta nach mó ná 3 bliana a ghearradh orthu
Attempting or helping others to commit an offence
Iarracht cion a dhéanamh nó cuidiú le daoine eile cion a dhéanamh
It is an offence to attempt to commit a drug offence covered by the legislation, or to help or incite someone else to commit the drug offence
Is cion é iarracht a dhéanamh cion drugaí a thagann faoi réim na reachtaíochta a dhéanamh nó cuidiú le duine éigin eile, nó a thabhairt ar dhuine éigin eile, an cion drugaí a dhéanamh
If you are found guilty you are liable to be sentenced as if you had committed the drug offence
Má fhaightear ciontach tú dlífear pianbhreith a chur ort amhail is go ndearna tú an cion drugaí

For some drugs offences, (illegal possession of controlled drugs, possession of controlled drugs for unlawful sale or supply, breaking the regulations regarding opium, growing opium poppies or cannabis plants or forging or fraudulently altering prescriptions), the court may decide that imposing the usual penalties is not the most effective response

Maidir le roinnt cionta drugaí (drugaí srianta i seilbh duine, drugaí srianta i seilbh duine lena ndíol nó lena soláthar go mídhleathach, briseadh na rialachán maidir le codlaidín, codlaidín nó cannabas a fhás, nó oidis a bhrionnú nó a athrú go calaoiseach), d’fheadfadh an chúirt a chinneadh nárbh iad na gnáthphionóis an freagra ab fhearr
The court can remand you for whatever period it considers necessary (no longer than eight days if you are being held in custody)
Féadfaidh an chúirt tú a chur siar faoi choinneáil ar feadh cibé tréimhse a mheasann sí is gá (ach gan dul thar ocht lá má bhíonn tú faoi choinneáil)

During this time, the court can ask the Health Service Executice (HSE), a probation officer or other qualified person to prepare a medical report and/or a report on your vocational, educational and social circumstances

I rith an ama sin, féadfaidh an chúirt a iarraidh ar Feidhmeannacht na Seirbhise Sláinte (FSS), ar oifigeach promhaidh nó ar dhuine incháilithe eile tuairisc sláinte a ullmhú nó/agus tuairisc faoi do chúinsí gairmiúla oideachasúla agus sóisialta
They may also be asked to make recommendations for your treatment
Féadfaidh sí a iarraidh orthu moltaí a dhéanamh faoi do chóireáilse
Based on the findings of these reports, the court may decide not to impose a fine or prison sentence on you

Ar bhunús na dtuairiscí sin, d’fhéadfadh an chúirt a chinneadh gan fíneáil ná príosúnacht a ghearradh ort, ach tú a chur faoi mhaoirsiú duine nó comhlachta ainmnithe (cosúil le Bord Sláinte) ar feadh tréimhse shonraithe áirithe

Instead, you may be placed under the supervision of a named person or body (such as the HSE) for a specified period of time or you may be required to get the kind of treatment (medical or otherwise) that has been recommended for you
Nó d’fhéadfá a bheith faoi iallach an chóireáil a moladh duitse a fháil (FSS nó eile)

The court may also order that you complete a course of education, instruction or training that will improve your job prospects or social circumstances, facilitate your social rehabilitation or reduce the likelihood of you committing further drugs offences

D’fhéadfadh an chúirt a ordú duit freisin cúrsa oideachais, teagaisc nó oiliúna a chomhlánú a fheabhsóidh d’ionchais fhostaíochta nó do chúinsí sóisialta, a éascóidh d'athshlánú sóisialta nó a laghdóidh an dóchúlacht go ndéanfaidh tú tuilleadh coireanna drugaí
Depending on the circumstances of your case, the court may order that you be detained in a specialised custodial treatment centre
Ag brath ar chúinsí do cháis, d’fhéadfadh an chúirt ordú a thabhairt go gcuirfí faoi choinneáil tú go hionad saincheaptha um chóireáil choinneála
The period you can be held for depends on your offence
Bhraithfidh fad na tréimhse a choinneofaí ann tú ar do chion

You cannot be held for longer than a year, but if the maximum period of imprisonment that the court may impose for your particular crime is shorter than a year, you can only be held for that period of time

Ní féidir tú a choinneáil níos faide ná bliain amháin, ach más rud é gur lú ná bliain an tréimhse phríosúnachta is faide a d’fhéadfaí a ghearradh ort do do choirse, ní féidir tú a choinneáil ach don tréimhse sin
If the court decides it is in your best interests, you may not be allowed to see the contents of any report that has been prepared on your case
Má mheasann an chúirt gurbh chun do leasa é, b’fhéidir nach gceadófaí duit inneachar aon tuairisce a ullmhaíodh faoi do chás a fheiceáil
However, the report will be made available to your barrister or solicitor
Cuirfear an tuairisc ar fáil do d’abhcóide nó do d’aturnae
If you ignore an order of the court, you can be detained in a custodial treatment centre or have the usual penalties for your offence (fines and/or imprisonment) imposed on you
Má dhéanann tú neamhaird d’ordú na cúirte, is féidir tú a choinneáil in ionad um chóireáil choinneála nó na gnáthphionóis do do chionsa (fíneálacha nó/agus príosúnacht) a ghearradh ort

If you have been sent to a custodial treatment centre by a court order, you can make an application to the court that detention is no longer in your best interest or in the best interests of other people at the centre
Má seoladh go hionad um chóireáil choinneála ar ordú cúirte tú, féadfaidh tú iarratas a chur faoi bhráid na cúirte nach chun do leasa é an choinneáil a thuilleadh, nó chun leasa daoine eile san ionad
Based on this application, the court can review your case and revoke the detention order
Ar bhunús an iarratais sin, féadfaidh an chúirt do chás a athbhreithniú agus an t-ordú coinneála a chealú
It then has a number of options open to it
Bíonn cúpla rogha ar oscailt di ansin
If the court decides that you are still in need of treatment, it can order your continued detention, possibly in another treatment centre
Má mheasann sí go bhfuil cóireáil fós ag teastáil uait féadfaidh sí do choinneáil leanúnach a ordú – in ionad eile más gá é sin
If custodial treatment is not considered necessary, you may be ordered to continue treatment but not on a custodial basis
Mura meastar cóireáil choinneála a bheith de dhíth, d’fhéadfaí tú a ordú leanúint den chóireáil ach gan í a bheith ar bhonn coinneála
The court can also decide to impose the usual penalties (prison sentence and/or fine) under the Misuse of Drugs Act for your offence if it considers it appropriate to do so
Féadfaidh an chúirt na gnáthphionóis a ghearradh ort faoin Acht um Mí-Úsáid Drugaí – fíneáil agus/nó tréimhse phríosúnachta – má mheasann sí iad a bheith cuí
This will depend on the circumstances of your case and if a prison sentence is imposed, the court must take into account the amount of time you have already been detained in a treatment centre
Braithfidh sé seo ar chúinsí do cháis, agus má ghearrtar príosúnacht ort, caithfidh an chúirt an méid ama atá caite agat san ionad cóireála a chur san áireamh
The court also has the option of not
Bíonn sé de rogha ag an gcúirt gan pionós ar bith a ghearradh ort má bhíonn sí sásta nach
imposing any penalty if it is satisfied that you are no longer in need of treatment and that the circumstances of your case do not warrant further penalties
bhfuil cóireáil ag teastáil uait a thuilleadh, agus nach gá aon phionós eile i do chás féin
